newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia's Sibneft plans 500 billion rouble bond.
newsitem.headline: Russia's Sibneft plans 500 billion rouble bond.

text.p: Russian oil company OAO Sibirskaya Neftyanaya Kompaniya (Sibneft) said on Thursday it planned to issue a 500 billion rouble two-year bond paying annula interest of 18 percent.
A Sibneft statement said the company's board had decided to propose the issue to a shareholder's meeting likely to be held in September.
Bondholders will have two options during the term of the bond to swap it for crude oil from Sibneft. Terms of the conversion were not yet available.
The bond is open to both foreign and domestic investors.
Denominations will be five million, 25 million and 50 million roubles, and interest would be paid once a year.
Sibneft is one of a dozen vertically integrated Russian oil groups. Its main operating unit is AO Noyabrskneftegaz NYGS.RTS.
The privatisation authorities are auctioning 34 percent of Sibneft over the next few months in two investment tenders, in which they are seeking investment of more than $77 million.
The Federal Property Fund plans to tender a stake of 19 percent of the company next month, with the winner announced on September 20, and a second stake of 15 percent will be tendered separately.

Foreign ownership in Sibneft is restricted to 15 percent of the capital. The previously unknown ZAO Neftyanaya Kompaniya and Stolichny Bank Sberezhenii won control of a 51 percent stake in Sibneft at the end of last year under the government's shares-for-loans scheme, in a bid backed by Bank Menatep.
